segments.text: You don't look too well . Maybe you should take the day off from work .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I couldn't do that . I have an important meeting to go to today .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Not really . After a 12 - hour flight , I've got jetlag , and on top of that , I think I've also got the flu .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Why don't you call your secretary and tell her to reschedule the meeting ? You should really get some rest or you'll end up feeling even worse than you do now .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Could you feel my forehead and check to see if I have a fever ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You're really hot . Let me get you some Tylenol to bring the fever down .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Ok . I'll stay home this morning and rest , but if I feel better in the afternoon , I'm going to the meeting .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Zach , what's that on your arm ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't know . It looks a bit red , but I'm sure it's nothing .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It looks like you have a red rash all over you ! Are you allergic to anything ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Just cats , but I don't think I was near any cats in the last couple of weeks .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I completely forgot about your cat allergy . I took care of a cat for my friend here a few days ago . Oh no . we'd better go to the doctor and get some medicine . Let's go .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Shouldn't we make an appointment first ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We would , but let's just go and see if there's an opening now before it gets worse .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Whatever you say . I just want to get to my meeting !
segments.speaker: S2
